title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Facing claims of animal abuse, a major breeder of research dogs will close its pipeline
items.description: Ridglan Farms has agreed to stop selling beagles for scientific studies, leaving just one major U.S. supplier

items.title: Vaccine protects people from paratyphoid fever in a ‘human challenge’ study
items.description: Volunteers who swallowed disease-causing bacteria were less likely to get sick after an oral vaccine

items.title: Aquarium hijinks provide strongest evidence yet that sharks love to play
items.description: Study hints at a deeper intelligence—and a need for enrichment in captivity

items.title: Meta and TikTok are obstructing researchers’ access to data, European Commission rules
items.description: Data are needed to study how social media spreads misinformation and influences elections, scientists say

items.title: To thwart food poisoning, tiny needles could inject bacteria-slaying viruses into your meal
items.description: Experimental patches on meat, fruits, and vegetables can destroy up to 99.9% of bacteria

items.title: A geoscientist shortage could undermine U.S.-Australian deal on critical minerals
items.description: Universities aren’t training the specialists needed to exploit the country’s rich resources

items.title: Alien worlds may be able to make their own water
items.description: Ocean planets could arise from rocks reacting with thick hydrogen atmospheres, lab experiments show

items.title: Innovative antivenom is a ‘potential game changer’ for snakebites
items.description: Synthetic cocktail of llama and alpaca “nanobodies” protected mice from venoms of 17 snakes

items.title: AI hallucinates because it’s trained to fake answers it doesn’t know
items.description: Teaching chatbots to say “I don’t know” could curb hallucinations. It could also break AI’s business model

items.title: Argentina’s move to woo Trump has derailed South America’s largest radio telescope
items.description: U.S.-Chinese tensions have left nearly complete observatory in limbo, jeopardizing research into pulsars and other celestial objects
